column5: Definition
Functions that allow users to visually map relevant concepts, processes, and other entities relevant to planning their research.
Functions that allow users to develop and manage implementation of a project plan.
column6: Microsoft Project, GanttPro, Redmine, Airtable, Trello

column5: Functions that enable planning for the logistics needed to support research in the field.
column6: Easyship, LogiMap, DELMIA Quintiq Logistics Planning

column5: Functions to enable the development and management of data management plans.
Functions that authenticate and/or control access to specific capabilities.
Functions that allow a user to interact with a system.

column3: User Interaction: Community Support / Social Networking
column5: Functions that allow users to form communities across space and time and to interact with one another remotely.
column6: AGU Connect, Facebook, MediaWiki, DokuWiki, Google groups, listservs, zoom

column5: Functions that allow notification of events, or other happenings.
Functions to create, update and remove user accounts and their rights and capabilities within a system.
Functions to control the operation of a scientific instrument.
column6: MATLAB Instrument Control Box, LabView, Systems Test and Operations Language

column5: Functions to calibrate an instrument.
Functions to handle data that is streaming in real-time.
Functions to ingest data into a data system.
Functions that enable an agents to query a system that retrieves a list of data matching the agent's search criteria and which might be suitable for their purpose.
column6: NSIDC Scientific Data Search, data.gov, USGS ScienceBase

column5: The function of extracting specified information/data from specific, targeted sites.
Functions that automatically and systematically search some portion of the World Wide Web for items that meet provided criteria (e.g., specific keywords, certain file types).
Functions that enable an agent to access or order data.
column6: NOAA's HadISST Sea Ice Component, 1Â°, Global, Monthly, 1870-present Data Subset Service, NSIDC Near-Real-Time SSM/I-SSMIS EASE-Grid Daily Global Ice Concentration and Snow Extent, Version 5 subscription service

column5: The function of systematically analyzing groups of data in order to uncover previously unknown patterns and relationships.
column6: RapidMiner Studio, STATISTICA, KNIME Analytics Platform

column5: Functions that allow users to perform initial investigations on data so as to discover patterns, to spot anomalies, to test hypothesis and/or to check assumptions with the help of summary statistics and graphical representations.
Functions that prospectively ensure the quality of data to be acquired or which verify the data's reasonableness after acquisition through the use of techniques such as flagging outlying values, etc.
Functions that allow users to extract a portion of a larger data set.
column6: channel selection, spatial subsetting, temporal subsetting

column5: Functions that help agents develop and/or validate the metadata and other markup needed to 1) make their data usable in the short and long term or 2) prepare it for further processing and analysis.
column6: AgriMetamaker, C Compliance Checker, M3Cat, Metacat, Morpho, SPASE metadata editor

column5: Functions that help ensure that the data being used is clean and consistent.
Functions that transform the representation of the data.
column6: spatial transformation, format conversion, interpolation, regridding, etc.

column5: Functions that allow users to anonymize, deidentify, blur or otherwise alter or hide portions of data to protect information because of ethical and legal issues
column6: ARX Data Anonymization Tool, Amnesia, sdcMicro

column3: Data Processing / Modeling: Grid or Mesh Generation
column5: Functions that generate geometrical shapes that cover a physical domain.

column3: Data Processing / Modeling: Test Data Generation
column5: Functions that generate test data.
Functions used to validate the output products of processing or modeling softare.
Functions that allow the outputs of one model to feed into another model.
Functions that convert data into a useable and desired form.
Functions that allow users to computationally model physical processes.
Functions that allow users to adjust model parameters and forcings so that model outputs match observed values.

column3: Data Processing / Modeling: Inversion / Data assimilation
column5: Functions that optimally combine theory, often in the form of models, with available data.
Functions that combine data from different sources into a single, unified view.
Functions that enable a workflow process to be reproduced.
Functions that enable management of the provenance of 1) the definition of a workflow, 2) a workflow run, and 3) the data used or created by the workflow.
Functions that enable the design or development of an orchestrated and repeatable pattern of activity.
Functions that enable arrangement, coordination, and management of a complex series of processes that depend on one another for their proper functioning.
Functions that use statistical methods to analyze time series data and extract meaningful statistics and characteristics about the data.
Functions that use formal techniques to study entities using their topological, geometric, or geographic properties
Functions for collecting, exploring and presenting large amounts of data to discover underlying patterns and trends.
Functions that allow quantitative analyses and/or algorithms applied to digital image (including multimedia) data.
Functions that parse texts in order to extract machine-readable facts from them, thereby creating structured data out of free text content.
Structured techniques used to mathematically analyze a network of interconnected components.
Functions (i.e., algorithms and statistical models) used to perform a specific task without using explicit instructions, relying on patterns and inference observed in input test data instead.
Functions that present data and information in a form suitable for visual perception and decision-making by a person.
Functions used to manipulate images or data so they appear as moving images.
Functions used to generate two-dimensional or three-dimensional images from a model.
Functions that automate or partly automate the generation of documentation.
Functions that transforms report data and layout information into a specific format.
Functions to collect and submit data so that accurate analyses of the facts on the ground can be performed.
Functions that allow the usage of a resource to be monitored.

Functions that enable data to remain accessible and usable for a period of time long enough for there to be concern about the impacts of changing technologies, including support for new media and data formats, and of a changing Designated Community.
Functions that enable the making copies of data or data files to use in the event the original data or data files are lost or destroyed.
Functions that enable the preservation of digital information, through transformation of the full information content from one form to another.
Functions that track changes made to a digital asset over time
Functions to improve the efficiency and quality of code.

Functions for evaluating and ascertaining the completeness and quality of code, determining if it complies with its requirements, performs functions for which it is intended and meets the organization's goals and user needs.
